New Records: Bas de Leede recorded the most expensive ten-over spell in ODIs with 2 for 115
Key Match Events: Netherlands won by 87 runs after Bangladesh's innings ended at 142/10
Taskin Ahmed's dismissal was a key moment in Bangladesh's loss
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh were coming off a 149-run defeat against South Africa, with Mahmudullah's century providing some encouragement
Netherlands had shown strong performances, including a win against South Africa and a close loss to Sri Lanka
Taskin Ahmed was expected to return to full fitness and play a key role for Bangladesh
Max O'Dowd was Netherlands' key batter despite a low score in the World Cup
Post-Match Reflections: Taskin Ahmed emphasized Bangladesh's ongoing World Cup journey and plans for future matches
Shakib Al Hasan's return was noted as a boost for Bangladesh's middle-order
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Bangladesh's first home game in the World Cup, drawing significant local support
Shane Bond's comments suggested Shakib Al Hasan's absence affected Bangladesh's morale
Others: The match was part of the 2023 ICC Cricket World Cup
